oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Examiner, June 29, 1878
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: W.F. Yardley
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Examiner. Vol. I, No. 10. Knoxville, Tenn. Saturday, June 29, 1878. Published every Saturday by W.F. Yardley, Office No. 15, Gay Street. Terms - $1.50 in advance. "Independent In All Things, Neutral In Nothing." Front page. J.J. O'Shea penciled in at top of page. Black (African American) weekly newspaper in Knoxville. Excerpts and names and topics of local interest have been noted in the full text field below.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Newspapers; African Americans;
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: The Examiner, June 29, 1878 folder in Oversize MSS Box 1
